channel.title: Creating new image with awt.Graphics?
channel.description: alright, so what i want to do is...... create new image. and i want to do this by pressing a button, lets say... enter. i already have key events, paint, ect... but i need to know how to actually create a new image every time i cilck the button, in different areas of the screen, lets say... on top of my character... anyone want to help? because i have no way to go about doing this. i can post what i tried if you all would like, but it was a fail

item.title: Creating new image with awt.Graphics?
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

[code]
List images = new ArrayList();

public void paint(Graphics g) {
for(MyImageClassLol image : images) {
image.paint(g);
}
}

public void addImage(MyImageClassLol lol) {
images.add(lol);
}

public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e) {
if(e.getKeyCode() == KeyEvent.VK_ENTER) {
addImage(myImageTypeInstance);
}
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Creating new image with awt.Graphics?
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

alright. this is my trying to explain. lets sayy… there is only 1 picture in the JFrame. the picture moves with the stroke of arrow keys(this is easy). i press the enter button, it creates a new image on the map. now there are 2 immages on the map.

im saying a completely new image that isnt added under my paint void, that will only show once i press that button, and untill i exit out of the game(because it is not actually added in my .java files)

does that make since? thats the best i can try to explain.

kind of like ::npc on moparscape (if any knows what im talkin about)

the npc isnt in the npc list, but you create a completely new one by typing ::npc 234
as soon as you exit out of the server, the npc is gone on the next start up.

Read full topic

item.title: Creating new image with awt.Graphics?
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

no im not actually
i dont think i was comprehended correctly hah.
ok, i am making my OWN 2d based game. what i want to do is, by the press of a button, pretty much SPAWN(create) a new image, where ever i want, how ever many times i want, on the map. looking at the link now…

createImage(int, int)
or
createImage(ImageProducer producer)

looks like it could take me into the right direction… still not sure how to use it so i will have to look into it

also unhandled, there is no reason to get snide like that… especially when i dont even know this newty guy? like wtf lol
